intro: Scleria muricata, commonly known as the rough sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Scleria muricata is often found in wet or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
